HOOPERCabinet Office, S.W.1.5th December, 1955.PRIME minister the Cabinet invited me (C.M.(55) 38th Conclusions, Minute 6) toascertain whether Mr. Leslie Bowes would be prepared to accept appointment as Chairman of the proposed Canals Committee and, in that event, to discuss further with him the composition of the Committee in the light of the views expressed by the Cabinet.2. Mr. Bowes has accepted my invitation to be Chairman and, after discussion with him, I would propose the following composition for theCommittee, with which he agrees :-Chairman:Mr. Leslie Bowes, C.B.E. (Managing Directorof the Pacific Steam Navigation Company).Members:(i) An industrialist (to be nominated by the Federationof British Industries). (ii) A local authority representative (to be nominated bythe Minister of Housing).(iii) Mr. W. A. Muddel, Chairman of the Trent RiverBoard. (Suggested by the Minister of Agriculture).(iv) Mr. Francis Ritchie, a Founder Member of theNational Parks Commission.(v) Mr. John "Wilson, C. 13. E., General Manager of the clyde Navigation Trust.(vi) Mr. John Corbett - a financial expert - SeniorPartner of Messrs. Peat Marwick and Mitchell.(Suggested by the Treasury).(vii) A Q, C. to be nominated by the Lord Chancellor.3. This gives seven members, which is one more than the Cabinet hadin mind, but I do not think that any one of the above could well be done without,I have, of course, not invited any of the suggested membership above and itmay be that not all of them would accept.2nd December, 1955.J,A.ij. -C.
